body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#24897](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24897) ([Draft / POC] Silent Payments by w0xlt)
* [#24836](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24836) (add RPC (-regtest only) for testing package policy by glozow)
* [#24539](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24539) (Add a "tx output spender" index by sstone)
* [#24408](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24408) (rpc: add rpc to get mempool txs spending specific prevouts by t-bast)
* [#24162](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24162) (rpc: add require_checksum flag to deriveaddresses by kallewoof)
* [#23549](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23549) (Add scanblocks RPC call (attempt 2) by jamesob)
* [#23417](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23417) (wallet, spkm: Move key management from DescriptorScriptPubKeyMan to wallet level KeyManager by achow101)
* [#23387](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23387) (WIP: add support to save fee estimates without having to shut down the node by greenaddress)
* [#23319](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23319) (rpc: Return fee and prevout (utxos) to getrawtransaction by dougEfresh)
* [#22751](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22751) (rpc/wallet: add simulaterawtransaction RPC by kallewoof)
* [#21283](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21283) (Implement BIP 370 PSBTv2 by achow101)
* [#19792](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19792) (rpc: Add dumpcoinstats by fjahr)
* [#19602](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19602) (wallet: Migrate legacy wallets to descriptor wallets by achow101)
* [#18933](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18933) (rpc: Add submit option to generateblock by MarcoFalke)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
